meanings.definition: Misgauges: to incorrectly measure or assess something
meanings.sent1: She misgauges the distance and ends up taking a longer route.
meanings.sent2: He often misgauges the amount of time it takes to complete a task.
meanings.sent3: The robot misgauges the size of the box and tries to fit it in a smaller space.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition rarely misgauges the true intentions of others.
meanings.sent5: The weather app misgauges the temperature, leading people to dress inappropriately.

meanings.definition: Misgauges: a plural noun referring to multiple incorrect measurements or assessments
meanings.sent1: The misgauges in the experiment caused confusion among the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The misgauges on the map led the hikers astray.
meanings.sent3: The misgauges in the recipe resulted in a disastrous cake.
meanings.sent4: The misgauges in the budget projections caused financial losses.
meanings.sent5: The misgauges in the survey data skewed the results significantly.
